content: When I shop online, I always look for the 'Rocket Delivery' badge first. If I can't get it tomorrow, I usually just go to the store instead. Time is more valuable than saving a few thousand won.
Anyone else tired of sites forcing you to download their app? I just want to buy one thing, not have 20 shopping apps on my phone ðŸ“±
ë¬´ì‹ ì‚¬ vs ì—ì´ë¸”ë¦¬ í›„ê¸° (Musinsa vs Ably reviews)

I always calculate the final price with shipping before I commit. Too many times I've added items to cart only to find out shipping costs more than the product. It's frustrating and feels like they're trying to trick you.
Returns are a nightmare in Poland. You have to print labels, go to the post office during work hours, keep all the packaging... I just avoid buying anything I'm not 100% sure about.
Why does every Allegro seller have different shipping policies? One offers free shipping, another charges 20 PLN for the same item. Make it simple!

I check prices multiple times per day because they change so fast. Yesterday a jacket was 800 TL, this morning 950 TL. The exchange rate makes everything unstable. When I see a good price, I buy immediately.
trendyol sahte Ã¼rÃ¼n nasÄ±l anlaÅŸÄ±lÄ±r (how to identify fake products on trendyol)
Customer service is impossible to reach. I tried calling, emailing, even messaging on Instagram. After a week, they finally responded on Twitter. Why is Twitter faster than their official support?
Users across all three markets show similar cart abandonment patterns: 68% abandon due to unexpected costs, 24% due to account creation requirements, 8% due to slow page load times.
Mobile shopping dominates evening hours (8 PM - 11 PM) with 78% of traffic. Desktop usage peaks during lunch breaks (12 PM - 2 PM) at 65%. Weekend patterns show more leisure browsing on mobile.
I trust blogger reviews more than official product descriptions. Bloggers show real usage, real problems. Company descriptions are always perfect - no product is perfect.
opinie o sklepie [shop name] (reviews about shop [shop name])
Hepsiburada vs Trendyol - which has better customer service? Need to return something but scared it will take months like last time ðŸ˜°

I use Naver Shopping to compare prices across all sites, then I go to the cheapest one. But honestly, if the difference is small I just buy from Coupang because I know it will arrive fast and returns are easy.
I never buy from new sellers with no reviews. Even if the price is better, it's not worth the risk. I've learned this the hard way.
Size charts are useless. Every brand is different. I have to read reviews specifically about sizing - 'is it true to size?' 'should I order one size up?' This is the most important information.
Trust is built slowly but destroyed instantly. One bad delivery experience and I will never use that platform again, no matter how cheap their prices are.
